subject: RE: [junit] mechanism to maintain session information across testcases?
msgSnippet: ... I d actually prefer to decouple the four steps in a way that recreating the state one of those steps needs isn t too hard. Each of those steps already
messageBody:
> Consider the following business logic:
>
> 1) Start server
> 2) Create connection pool
> 3) Send message
> 4) Receiver of message stores values in the DB
>
> In order to test these four steps, it makes sense to
> accumulate the state of the previous phases so that you don't
> have to recreate it from scratch.

I'd actually prefer to decouple the four steps in a way that recreating the
state one of those steps needs isn't too hard.

Each of those steps already sounds complex enough to test on its own. We
will probably want to have more than one test for each, which will likely
lead to a "combinatorical explosion" if we test all the four steps together.
It might also be less than easy to recreate a specific error condition for
step 4) by executing steps 1)-3), for example.

And, of course, the decoupling leads to a design with which it's more easy
to reuse single parts, or to replace them by others.

Cheers, Ilja
